title: PM says Reform plan 'racist' and Labour eyes 'good citizen test'
description: Sir Keir Starmer's criticism of Reform and policy announcements ahead of Labour conference dominate the papers.
content:
The front pages are dominated by Labour's conference announcements, especially its drive to counter Reform.
The Times says, external moves by the Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood to tighten immigration policy are an attempt to stymie the popularity of ... [1903 chars]

title: McIlroy condemns ‘unacceptable’ Ryder Cup abuse and reveals his wife was hit by a beer
description: An emotional Rory McIlroy opened up on how he and his wife Erica were treated by the crowds during the tournament in Bethpage
content: An emotional Rory McIlroy opened up on the abuse he received during the Ryder Cup after Europe secured a famous win in New York. The 15-13 success for the visitors at Bethpage Black came against the backdrop of awful spectator behaviour, largely towa... [4364 chars]

title: Mark Gurman: iPhone 17e Will Make Enough Compromises To Render The Base iPhone 17 A Very Attractive Proposition
description: One analyst thinks that Apple will handicap the iPhone 17e so as to prevent the cheaper smartphone from overshadowing the base iPhone 17.
content: Apple sort of bludgeoned the base iPhone 16 earlier this year when it launched the iPhone 16e with enough features to overshadow its pricier sibling. The Cupertino giant, however, appears to have learned from its mistakes and is bent upon releasing t... [2091 chars]

title: Games Inbox: Is the PS5 good value for money?
description: Monday’s Inbox recommends getting a PS5 via the current price cut, as a reader asks if The House Of The Dead 2 remake is worth getting.
content:
The Monday letters page is surprised there are no different colours yet for the Switch 2, as a reader praises Insomniac Games for being one of the quickest game developers.
Games Inbox is a collection of our readers’ letters, comments, and opinions. ... [9045 chars]

title: Tui flight makes emergency landing at Birmingham Airport after take-off bird strike
description: Birmingham Airport suspended its operations to enable the aircraft to land
content:
A Tui flight from Cardiff Airport to Cyprus declared an emergency and was forced to divert to Birmingham following a bird strike shortly after take-off.
The Boeing 737, flight number TOM 6754 , was bound for Paphos when the incident occurred at 4.30p... [1859 chars]
